qas.question: How do people know which days to not drive their car?

answers.text: ending digit of their license plates

qas.question: How many cars were still restricted in 2003?
When were new emisson standards enacted?
How can cars get exempt from the restrictions?

context: There is an environmental program, called Hoy No Circula ("Today Does Not Run", or "One Day without a Car"), whereby vehicles that have not passed emissions testing are restricted from circulating on certain days according to the <a0_0>ending digit of their license plates<a0_0/>; this in an attempt to cut down on pollution and traffic congestion. While in 2003, the program still restricted <a1_0>40%<a1_0/> of vehicles in the metropolitan area, with the adoption of stricter emissions standards in 2001 and <a2_0>2006<a2_0/>, in practice, these days most vehicles are exempt from the circulation restrictions as long as they <a3_0>pass regular emissions tests<a3_0/>.
